name: OrderConfirmation
purpose: Displays a confirmation screen after successful order placement, providing order summary information and navigation options for the user.

architecture.description: The order_confirmation feature follows MVVM architecture with a focus on the presentation layer, as it primarily serves as a UI component after order processing.

components.implementation_description: Composable function that displays order confirmation UI with success animation, order details, and action buttons for post-order navigation.

components.purpose: Manages the state and navigation for the order confirmation screen

User selects next action (return home, check order status, or contact support)

dataFlow.description: The order_confirmation feature presents a simple conclusion to the order flow
sources: Previous order placement screen providing order details
transformations: Formatting of confirmation message and details

developers_notes: The order_confirmation feature is intentionally simple, functioning primarily as a UI component at the end of the order flow rather than performing business logic. Its main responsibility is to provide a clear confirmation to users that their order was successful and offer navigation options for next steps. The feature currently does not retrieve or display detailed order information, which could be a potential enhancement to show order number, estimated delivery time, or other order-specific details. The success animation is implemented using Compose animation APIs and could be refined for better performance on lower-end devices. This feature has minimal dependencies on other components, making it stable and less prone to breaking changes.
